api.name: indexGithubRepo
api.description: Set the github repository url for clone and code indexing.

repo_url.description: The github repo URL to be indexed.

api.name: refreshProjectIndex
api.description: Set project path and Refresh the project index for latest changes

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

api.name: searchCode
api.description: Search for code matches within the indexed files.

extensions.description: Optional list of file extensions to filter search. You can fill or ignore extensions based on user prompt

case_sensitive.description: Whether the search is case-sensitive. You can fill or ignore extensions based on user prompt

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

api.name: findFiles
api.description: Find files in the project that match the given pattern.

pattern.description: Find files in the project that match the given pattern. Supports glob patterns like *.py or **/*.js. You should edit this param based on user prompt

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

api.name: getFileSummary
api.description: Get a summary of a specific file, including, file content(if specific), line count, functions, classes, imports statements, and basic complexity metrics.

file_path.description: Path to the file to summarize.

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

include_file_content.description: Whether to include the file conent. Based on user prompt and the chat context, you should decide whether to include the file content or not.

api.name: gitStatusTool
api.description: Shows the git working tree status (changes not staged, changes staged, untracked files).

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

api.name: gitShowTool
api.description: Shows the git working tree status (changes not staged, changes staged, untracked files).

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

revision.description:
Identify the specific point in history to show. **You (the AI) MUST determine the correct revision based on the user's request.** Examples include: 
- A full commit hash (e.g., 'f7e6a5b4c3d2e1f0a9b8c7d6e5f4a3b2c1d0e9f8')
- A short commit hash (e.g., 'f7e6a5b')
- A branch name (e.g., 'main', 'develop', 'feature/user-auth')
- A tag name (e.g., 'v1.0', 'v2.1.3-beta', 'release-candidate')
- Special references like 'HEAD' (the currently checked-out commit)
- Relative references like 'HEAD~1' (one commit before HEAD), 'main~3' (three commits before the tip of main), 'v1.0^' (the first parent of the commit tagged v1.0).
If the user asks for 'the latest commit', use 'HEAD' or the relevant branch name.

api.name: gitLogTool
api.description: Shows the git working tree status (changes not staged, changes staged, untracked files).

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

max_count.description: Optional. The maximum number of commit logs to retrieve. (default: 10)

api.name: git_search_commits_tool
api.description: Search through indexed commits for code, messages, or file paths matching the query.

project_path.description: The project path of the project/repository. You(AI system) must to fill this params(project_path) if it already exists in your memory or using the project path result after you successfully clone the repo.

query.description: The search term for code, messages, or file paths. You can edit this param based on user prompt

max_results.description: Maximum number of search results to return (default: 10).

search_file_content.description: Whether to search within the content of files in commits (default: true).

search_commit_messages.description: Whether to search within commit messages (default: true).

search_file_paths.description: Whether to search within the paths of files changed in commits (default: true).

author.description: Optional. Only search commits by this author.
